intro: Melampyrum roseum var. ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaved touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
